intro: Cheiridopsis schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter’s ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its low water requirements, it is well-suited for arid and semi-arid climates.
